title: Pipe Spring National Monument: Kwi´uv
body: Kwi´-uv          Quercus Turbinella  Acorns of this scrub live-oak were collected for food. The acorn meats were roasted, boiled, or ground into flour. Kwi´-uv provided a slow, longburning fuel in a region where hardwoods are scarce. Live-oak wood made tough bows.          << back   continue >>
